entry.title: Brotherly Bonding Activities
entry.summary:
Author: fagcreature

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,944Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 244

Summary: Dick smiled at him, and whispered: “We’ll figure it out together, yeah?”Jason froze, heart beginning to hammer in his chest. Jason wasn’t entirely sure what they would be doing, but he knew it would involve taking his pants off, and surely that’s not something brothers were supposed to do together, right? That just... doesn’t sound right. But Jason’s never had a brother before. How should he know? Jason also didn’t know how touching himself worked, and Dick apparently didn’t know either, so maybe this was just how they would bond as brothers. Learn something new together and grow closer in the process.Jason squeaked out a little “okay”, but Dick hadn’t waited for it, already shuffling closer to him on the bed before Jason could make a sound. - Dick convinces Jason to let him touch his pussy, for the purpose of learning about his anatomy together, of course. Jason doesn't exactly like it, but he trusts his older brother. EDIT: Chapter 2 is an alternate ending, where Bruce walks in and Jason gets a hug.

entry.title: Pretty Boy Psychopath
entry.summary:
Author: Skalidra

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,427Chapters: 1/2Kudos: 96

Summary: When Jason Todd is thirteen, a Talon rips his throat out for trying to steal the tires off of the President of Gotham's car. He survives. At twenty, he's a sworn member of the League of Assassins and the CEO of a brand new company, all set to make his return to Gotham and take the revenge he's lived the last seven years of his life dreaming of. All he has to do is make the right approach.When Richard Grayson was sixteen, he killed a boy in an alley. As far as he was concerned, that was the end of it.~(Based in the universe of the 'Tales From the Dark Multiverse: Batman: Hush' oneshot comic.)

entry.title: Glass Rain
entry.summary:
Author: soaring_bubblegum

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 228,079Chapters: 49/53Kudos: 1,766

Summary: Jason Todd wakes up in the wrong Gotham. Here, he stayed dead. Here, his death broke his family so completely they became the monsters they once fought. Dick Grayson haunts the skyline with wings and talons, Barbara Gordon moves like a spider made of shadow, and something that might have once been Batman rules from a corrupted cave. The city is quarantined, the air tastes of ozone and old blood, and Jason should be running. Instead, he finds himself drawn to the creature that was once his brother—the one stalking him through twisted streets with eyes that still burn with something almost human. Some hunts, it turns out, go both ways.
